entries.meaning: A young woman employed to look after a baby or young child. [from 18th c.]
examples: Caroline was that hard and unalterable fact which turned Martha's life, in spite of a pleasant and helpful nursegirl, into a routine which began at five sharp every morning when the light first showed, and ended at seven in the evening, when she went to bed.

entries.meaning: A young woman who help to take care of the sick or infirm.
